name: CHC Sea Side Resort & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We weren't sure that an all inclusive was for us so we tried it out with just three nights here and sure enough it wasn't was for us but is a nice hotel. First off, it kind of under delivered given we arrived thinking it was five star - can't remember now if it does really say it is or if we just picked up that impression along the way. Anyway, it isn't. Four star yes as is v nice but it lacks the style and options of a five star. The room was pleasant and roomy, no wow factor but with a smart bathroom. Service was really friendly and helpful. Reception were lovely when my husband wanted some cream and plasters for a minor injury and the restaurant staff were crazy busy but very pleasant. I was disappointed to see just one beer and one red and one white wine were on offer as included in the deal for those who want wine or beer. I didn't much like any of them (husband happy though - I am a little fussier!) and expected a couple of options. As a veggie I ate similar meals for each lunch and dinner. A week would have been tedious for me but the quality of the food was at the top of our expectations, lovely fresh salads, fab soft bread, nice cheese and husband found most of the meat to be good. The pool area got quite busy and it wasn't high season but that said we did get loungers ok each day. Was a bit disappointed at so many children at what I thought was an adults only pool. Basically, wouldn't go back but would recommend for people that like an all inclusive break - it was v nice and is in a beautiful spot - many of the rooms (even our one at the cheap end of the spectrum) have sea views and the pool area looks out to sea and is a beautiful vista.
reviews.title: Nice, just not really for us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival we were given an upgrade to a suite as one was available. The spa was our first port of call to book numerous treatments all of which were reasonable in price and fantastically administered. We enjoyed it so much we tried to book more before we left but were unlucky as others beat us to it.
reviews.title: Sorry it took so long to write
sea side spa resort crete
reviews.text: I recommend having the a la carte dinner on the balcony. The staff treat you like royalty and look after your every whim.
The views are spectacular and the hotel very clean.
reviews.title: Not a 5 star hotel!!

reviews.text: I recommend the renting of a car to explore the region, it was a great experience for us.
reviews.title: This is NOT a 5 star hotel. Almost 3

reviews.text: The views and location of this hotel make it something special. From the top pool or the lower pool, the views are just awesome. Relaxing in a lounger or chair enjoying the sun with a drink from the bar, it does not get much better than this on holiday.
reviews.title: Wonderful sea views for a relaxing great value holiday

reviews.text: The animation team were to be found at the top bar during the day providing yoga, Aquarobics, a midday game, darts, French boule, table tennis and Zumba just to liven things up for a short time. The lower pool area was a quieter area if that is what you wanted. The pool areas have decking round them which is cooler to the feet than the hot tiles, but to avoid splinters you may be best advised to take some appropriate shoes for your feet.
reviews.title: Great Entertainment team.Good food. Great relaxing area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the Hotel on a week’s all-inclusive deal with land views. The rooms were comfortable and in the lower floors of the hotel under the Chinese Restaurant with side views of the sea and beach below. The food was really good with a nice selection. The Greek salad each day was good, some of the food each evening was themed each evening with Greek, Italian, Mexican dishes to choose. The sweets were excellent.
reviews.title: Relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a resort hotel and apart from the beach, a couple of tavern’s and a bar not much close bye if you like to go for a walk after a meal, or explore during the day. The drinks at the hotel were good, on the all inclusive you could have any of the local drinks at no charge, the beer was OK, The gin and Brandy was good, and the wine drinkable. It is not until you go out of the hotel that you see the local prices for drinks and food and realise what great value the all-inclusive deal that the hotel provides. The Main bar was good at night and the staff helpful and friendly and the animation team had quizzes and karaoke and little shows in the TV/ Relax room off the main bar.
reviews.title: Very Good for a peaceful relaxing time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The sea was great to swim in but take some shoes or flip-flops as the sand is rough, and getting in and out you have small rocks and pebbles, which are hard on the feet.
reviews.title: Very relaxing

reviews.text: We were sent here by our travel company as our hotel in another resort was closed for refurbishment. As this was an upgrade from what we had booked we were really pleased. The hotel was clean, relaxing and good value. We enjoyed the range of food available at meal times, with food to cater for a 2 year old, and a traveller who only eats fish. We spent a lot of time relaxing by the pool and found the animation team did a great job keeping the atmosphere fun without being too in your face. All in all we had a fab time!
reviews.title: A great place to relax.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a week here in June. All we wanted was to go from pool to beach and back again. If like us you want a quiet relaxing break this hotel is ideal. If you want action and activity, then I suggest you look elsewhere. There is not a lot to do in and around the hotel. No shops to talk about apart from the odd beach shop, bar etc. ie no resort. I thought the evening meals were a bit same'ish day in day out. And yes, the hotel is built on many levels and may not be suitable to some. Right, so why have I rated it very good, because it is. We holiday on a regular basis and I think I know when I'm getting good value for money. If you want peace and quiet, book it.
reviews.title: Ideal for relaxing holiday

reviews.text: We had a great holiday! The seaview is amazing. The design of the hotel is very modern. It is very quiet. Not many kids (which we prefered. If you have kids don't stay at this resort, i'm sure they will be bored very quick). The staff is friendly. Most of the people are slightly older. There are quite a lot of russians. The evenings are slightly boring, no free drinks after 11pm. The entertainment is very bad, i don't like silly games with ice cube etc. there is a disco in the evenings which is quite boring ( in a meeting room with people sitting at staring at the people who dance...).
reviews.title: Excellent hotel!

reviews.text: Please don't go to the chinese restaurant it is tasteless and i actually think the prepare everything in the microwave.
reviews.title: Excellent relaxing holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Apart from that it is a brilliant hotel. And we really enjoyed our stay!
reviews.title: A lovely relaxing hotel

reviews.text: We had a fantastic holiday in this hotel. Initially scared after reading few negative reviews about this hotel, but thought we will try out, and it was a very good decision. Ours is a family of 2 adults and 5yr old child and 4month infant. It was first time we were travelling with 4 month and were a bit anxious.
reviews.title: Excellent holiday

reviews.text: We were very late to check in and could not call them up to request for food. But receptionist Saula was fantastic, soo welcoming and made arrangements for vegetarian food for that night. She also arranged a lovely PRAM for our 4 month old free of charge which was so handy and our 4 month old loved it. Our accommodation was clean and tidy and specious. I would grade it as 3 star though. Animation team were amazing and arranged various sports to keep us entertained. Views from the hotel were also amazing. We got few fantastic sunrise and suset photos. My daughter enjoyed her time in swimming pool to her satisfaction. Both the Poolside bars offered very nice drinks including yummy cocktails. There was no time for my little one to attend the children's miniclub though she visited it for half an hour and the children's disco for 10min which she enjoyed.
reviews.title: Relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only problem we had was options for food. We are vegetarians and struggled to get options for food. Salads and pasta were the only options but Main poolside bar offered hot vegetarian Pizzas which were really yummy and we had all our Lunch there. Hot pizzas were avaiable all the time and you would get tired of eating..
reviews.title: great vacation

reviews.text: Beach is only 3min away but its only tiny and my daughter was disappointed as there was no sand and she could not build a sand castle. But hotel offered other services like car rental, tour arrangements and we rented a car and visited nearby attractions and lovely beaches.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: In total it was a very nice holiday and we would like to convey our special THANKS TO RECEPTIONIST SAULA FOR BEING SO HELPFUL.
reviews.title: NOT GOOD

description: Sea Side Resort & Spa is one of the best hotels in Crete; it combines affordable holidays in luxurious settings, natural gardens, all under the sea breeze of the Aegean Sea. Friendly staff, great accommodation, attention to detail; all these ensure a memorable holiday to all of our guests. Sea Side Resort & Spa is a great way to spend your Greek holiday.
